summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. The logs detail mandatory irregular checks for inmates in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observation at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Rounds at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Mandatory 30-minute observation checks were conducted throughout the day and night for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous lockdown status.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 9, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in continuous lockdown (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs cover multiple tiers (L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, K, G, H, ZB) within the SHU, indicating a structured monitoring system.
Each sheet was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, showing a chain of oversight.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) evidence file series related to the Epstein case.
